chapter.title: Introduction to &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION;
chapter.para: M3UA stands for MTP3 User Adaptation Layer. M3UA addresses the need for conecting SS7 legacy services with IP entities like database servers.
In technical terms, M3UA allows for signaling between Switched Circuit Network (SCN) border devices (Signaling Gateway - SG) and Media Gateway Controllers (MGC) or Database servers to be exchanged.
The M3UA transport mechanism covers the following aspects:

listitem.para: Support for the transfer of all SS7 MTP3-User Part messages (e.g., ISUP, SCCP, TUP, etc.)
Support for the seamless operation of MTP3-User protocol peers
Support for the management of SCTP transport associations and traffic between an SG and one or more MGCs or IP-resident Databases
Support for MGC or IP-resident database process failover and load sharing
Support for the asynchronous reporting of status changes to management
